dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is snowing lightly. Phil and Rita are walking slowly, in arm, close. They stop and embrace. Phil looks at Rita. She looks like an angel.

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: Wait! Don't move!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil scoops up some snow and begins packing it down, furi joyously, then rolling it into a large ball.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: Making a snow man? I'll help.

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: No, stay there. Stand right th ere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ph il lifts the now larger chunk of packed snow and sets a mailbox. Then he looks at her, and starts to sculpt it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil is using a stick and the heat of his bare hands to m a delicate fold in the snow sculpture. Several bystanders o n with interest as Phil stands back from his work.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: Can I look?

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: O kay, look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is an excellent likeness of Rita, the snow white as alabaster, pure as marble, a beautiful and delicate homag

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: (OVERWHELMED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody's ever done this for me. Not even a drawing. It's beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: This is how I see you. When it all gets too much, I just close my eyes and there you are-- just like this. Take it home and keep it in the freezer. Rita embraces Phil. They are about to kiss, looking deep each others eyes.

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: This one's for the Frog Prince.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: Nothing. They kiss-- a long, deep, soul-stirring kiss.

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: Will you come with me? Rita nods. They continue standing there, embracing, warmi each other in the cold night air.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: (looks back at the ice

dialogues.speaker: SCULPTURE
dialogues.text: We're just going to leave her?

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: It doesn't matter. Really, it doesn't. They kiss again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The digital clock-radio changes from 5:59 to 6:00. Silenc No Sonny and Cher, no deejays-- nothing. Phil sits up in bed. He looks around the room. Things are different, messier. Then he sees the covers move. Wide-ey now, he looks over and sees Rita waking up, snuggling dee under the covers.

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: (DISBELIEVING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not true. It's not. It can't be true. Rita? Rita!

dialogues.speaker: LUXURIOUSLY
dialogues.text: Mmmm. Morning. Phil pounces on Rita, showering her with kisses.

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: You're here! My god! I can't believe you're here!

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: Glad to see you, too.

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: No! It's happened. Don't you get it? It's tomorrow! It's -- Phil turns on the radio.

dialogues.speaker: DEEJAY
dialogues.text: . . . still shoveling put the highways, but if you're walking, it's a beautiful day.

dialogues.speaker: S IDEKICK
dialogues.text: Yeah, the snow kind of cleaned e ve r yt h in g up--

dialogues.speaker: DEEJAY
dialogues.text: --except your mouth. Phil kisses the radio.

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: I love those guys.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: Are you always this jolly in the morning? Phil runs to the window and looks out.

dialogues.speaker: THE STREET
dialogues.text: The street ;is virtually empty, the town just waking up. are throwing snowballs.

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: No groundhog! Rita! They're all gone!

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: You must've had some dream. Phil stops, thinks.

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: Did I just dream it? Phil opens the door and runs into the hallway wearing onl pajama bottoms.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: Phi l? Phil! Rita sits up in bed and waits. Suddenly, from somewhere e in the inn comes the sound of Phil at the piano expertly playing a difficult classical piece. He stops after a few bars.

dialogues.speaker: PHIL, (O.C.)
dialogues.text: Yeah!!!! Phil runs back into the room.

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: It really happened! You're really here! He pounces on Rita again.

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: You're really actually here.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: (LAUGHING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here, I'm here! They kiss, passionately, hungrily.

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: Let's go! He scoops her up in his arms.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: Where're we going?

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: Anywhere! Everywhere!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil and Rita, dressed now, enter and encounter Mrs. Lanc Phil hugs her.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. LANCASTER
dialogues.text: Oh, my!

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: Florence! Say hello to Rita. She loves me.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. LANCASTER
dialogues.text: I'm not surprised. He kisses her on the cheek and rushes out with Rita.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil and Rita walk down Main Street hand in hand.

dialogues.speaker: A MAN
dialogues.text: Phil! Good morning!

dialogues.speaker: A LADY
dialogues.text: Mr. Connors. I wanted to thank you.

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: That's all right. I-- A FLORIST steps out of the flower shop with a bouquet.

dialogues.speaker: FLORIST
dialogues.text: Phil, here. I want you to have these.

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: Thanks, Carl. Phil smells the flowers, and hands the bouquet to Rita.

dialogues.speaker: PHIL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And so began my final lifetime, and ended the longest winter on record. I would find myself no longer able to affect the chain of events in this town, but I did learn something about time. You can waste time, you can kill time, you can do time, but if you use it wisely, there's never enough of it. So you'd better make the most of the time you've got. A car skids on the ice and smashes into a tree. Phil and rush over to help, but the driver waves that he's okay. R and Phil continue their walk.

dialogues.speaker: PHIL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Larry never got through the blizzard, so none of my groundhog reports ever made it on the air. But Rita and I-- we lived happily ever after. Phil and Rita walk off together. Across the street, Larry is trying to get rid of Ned Ryer who is doggedly trying to sell him insurance.

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: But Phil told me you were his accountant!

dialogues.speaker: LARRY
dialogues.text: Look, I told you! He's nuts! Larry keeps trying to walk away, but Ned won't leave him

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: Let me just tell you about single premium life-- Finally, Larry slugs Ned and storms off, leaving Ned floundering in a snowbank. Phil and Rita walk on as we pull up and away from Main St revealing the whole of Punxsutawney and the snowy country that embraces it.
